definition: to lessen the amount, force, magnitude, or value of : weaken
examples: … shows great skill in the use of language to moderate or attenuate the impact of awkward facts.

definition: to reduce the severity, virulence, or vitality of

examples: Glass can be attenuated into fibers.

definition: to make thin in consistency : rarefy
to become thin, fine, or less
reduced especially in thickness, density, or force
examples: the attenuate limbs of a starving person

definition: tapering gradually usually to a long slender point
